item.title: Key Board Reader Class
item.dc:creator: @kunk kunk
item.description:
@kunk wrote:

~ Credits 50% me 50% oblakastouf
He made the skeleton and I finished it off…
He just posted it b4 me on moparscape…
Here it is

[code]
//By oblak (oblak owns)
import java.io.*;
public class KeyboardReader
{
private InputStreamReader in;
private BufferedReader console;
private String data;

//Constructor for the objects of this class…
//1st = default

public KeyboardReader()throws IOException
{
in = new InputStreamReader(System.in);
console = new BufferedReader(in);
data = “”;
}

public int readInt()throws IOException
{
data = console.readLine();
int num = Integer.parseInt(data);
return num;
}

public int readInt(String message)throws IOException
{
System.out.println(message);
data = console.readLine();
int num = Integer.parseInt(data);
return num;
}

public double readDouble()throws IOException
{
data = console.readLine();
double num = Double.parseDouble(data);
return num;
}

public double readDouble(String message)throws IOException
{
System.out.println(message);
data = console.readLine();
double num = Double.parseDouble(data);
return num;
}

public String readString()throws IOException
{
data = console.readLine();
return data;
}

public String readString(message)throws IOException
{
System.out.println(message);
data = console.readLine();
return data;
}

public char readChar()throws IOException
{
data = console.readLine();
double letter = data.charAt(0);
return letter;
}

public char readChar(String message)throws IOException
{
System.out.println(message);
data = console.readLine();
double letter = data.charAt(0);
return letter;
}
}[/code]
